basis

Class GameManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.TimerTask
      • basis.GameManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AntGameManager

    public class GameManager
extends java.util.TimerTask
    This class is responsible for creating games when appropriated. Here, "appropriated" means that bots should have relatively equitable scores and should not wait for too long in the lobby.
    Author:
    Jonathan, Juliette

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Creates game for bots if appropriated. { @code import java.util.timer; Timer timer = new Timer(); long whenToStart = 0; long interval = 3000; timer.scheduleAtFixedRate(gameManager, whenToStart, interval); }
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Specified by:
        run in class java.util.TimerTask

      • fillChallengers

        public void fillChallengers()
        Fill the possible challenger for a bot depending of its priority. It actually fills the vector of the bot HashMap.

      • chooseFights

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<Bot>> chooseFights(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<Bot>> matchsList)
        Function that chooses which fights should be played. It's based on the sum of the priority to the bots. It modifies the MatchsList so only chosen fights remain.
        Parameters:
        matchsList - the list of possible matchs.
        Returns:
        a list of matchs to do.

      • setBotsInFight

        public void setBotsInFight(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<Bot>> toFightList)
        Set the bots in the list as fighting. Implies resetting the priority, removing them from the map and from the vector of the other bots, and set their status as inGame.
        Parameters:
        toFightList - a list of games to create/bots associations.

      • findCompatibleLists

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<Bot>> findCompatibleLists(int nbPlayers)
        Find the compatible lists in the bot map. (this means the matchs possibles)
        Parameters:
        nbPlayers - the number of player we want to make fight each other.
        Returns:
        a list of list of possible matchs, null if no match is possible.

      • isListInMatrix

        private boolean isListInMatrix(java.util.ArrayList<Bot> child,
                               java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<Bot>> parent)
        Function to know if a list of bot is in a list of list of bot (in any order).
        Parameters:
        child - the list of bot.
        parent - the list of list of bot.
        Returns:
        true if child is in parent, false otherwise.

      • isEachListUnique

        public boolean isEachListUnique(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<Bot>> botMatrix)
        Checks the uniqueness of each list in the bot matrix. Uniqueness is here defined as the presence of a bot in AT MOST ONE list
        Parameters:
        botMatrix - the list of list to check.
        Returns:
        true if each list is unique, false otherwise.

      • incrementPosToTest

        public boolean incrementPosToTest(int[] posToTest,
                                  java.util.Vector<Bot> v)
                           throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Function that enables to update the values in posToTest, so it helps explore the tree.
        Parameters:
        posToTest - array to update.
        v - a vector representing the tree.
        Returns:
        a boolean that indicates a success.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException

        public void addBot(Bot bot)

      • removeBot

        public boolean removeBot(Bot bot)
        Function to remove a bot from the botMap and every occurrence in the vector of others bots.
        Parameters:
        bot - the bot to remove from the bot map.
        Returns:
        true if the bot was in the bot map.
